alert.note: Alert for Bland; Giles; Pulaski; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties of Bland, Giles, Pulaski, and Wythe. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 343 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Mudlick Branch, New River, Back Creek, Dry Branch, Carper Branch, Little Walker Creek, Bentley Branch, Cove Creek, Altoona Branch and Kimberling Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wytheville... Poplar Hill... Long Spur... Bane... Parrott... Mc Coy... Eggleston... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
